title: BOP & Riser Deployment - AI Probing Questions

questions.question: When was the last full BOP overhaul? Are all components within their certification period?
questions.expectedResponse: Overhaul date and certification status of all components

questions.question: If the wellhead connector fails to latch, what's your contingency?
The programme shows 36 hours for BOP deployment and test - does this account for weather delays?
What's your response if initial BOP test fails? How many repair attempts before you pull the stack?
questions.expectedResponse: Clear decision criteria and escalation path

questions.question: ROV availability - do you have redundancy if primary ROV fails during critical operations?
questions.expectedResponse: Backup ROV availability or alternative procedures

questions.question: What is the maximum water depth rating of your BOP vs actual water depth?
questions.expectedResponse: BOP depth rating with adequate margin

questions.question: Deadman and autoshear were tested on surface - when will they be function tested subsea?
Your accumulator precharge is set for surface conditions - has it been adjusted for seabed temperature?
If you get a stack leak during initial test, what's your minimum acceptable test duration for a repair decision?
questions.expectedResponse: Defined test duration and leak rate criteria

questions.question: The riser has been stored for 6 months - have all joints been inspected and drift checked?
What's your emergency disconnect sequence time? Has this been verified recently?
Maximum predicted current is 2 knots but your riser analysis was done for 1.5 knots - have you updated the analysis?
